intro: Calycadenia, commonly known as desert smokeplant, is a genus of flowering plants native to the western United States and northern Mexico. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. They are characterized by their slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are usually narrow and may be covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Calycadenia species are often used in xeriscaping due to their drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
